intro: Manulea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf manulea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
